newsitem.title: GERMANY: German official joins Salomon as EMU expert.
newsitem.headline: German official joins Salomon as EMU expert.

text.p: Guenther Thumann, an official in the German economics ministry, will rejoin U.S. investment bank Salomon Brothers to coordinate the bank's European Monetary Union research project, the bank said on Tuesday.
Thumann will join Salomon's European economic and market analysis team as coordinator of the EMU research project, which is based in London.

Thumann served as Salomon's senior German economist in Frankfurt from 1994-1995 and left to head the international economic and financial affairs department at the Bonn economics ministry in August 1995.
He initially joined the ministry in 1978 and spent six years as a senior economist at the International Monetary Fund in Washington.
